001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.nn;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Decorator;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.activations.ActivationFunction;
005
006import java.util.LinkedList;
007import java.util.List;
008
009/**
010 * A {@link Neuron} that caches activations for later retrieval.
011 *
012 * <p>This neuron extends the base {@link Neuron} class and stores a list of
013 * {@link Activation} objects, which contain the input values, target digit,
014 * output, and gradient for each activation. This is useful for
015 * <strong>backpropagation, debugging, or analysis</strong> of the neuron’s behavior over time.
016 *
017 * <p>The class is annotated with {@link Decorator} to indicate that it
018 * enhances the standard neuron with caching functionality.
019 *
020 * @see Neuron
021 * @see ActivationFunction
022 */
023@Decorator
024public class ActivationsCachedNeuron extends Neuron {
025
026    /**
027     * Represents a single activation of a neuron.
028     *
029     * <p>Stores the following information for each activation:
030     * <ul>
031     *     <li>{@code inputs} – the input values received by this neuron during activation</li>
032     *     <li>{@code output} – the output produced by the neuron</li>
033     *     <li>{@code parameterGradients_df_dp} – the gradient calculated for this output (useful for learning)</li>
034     * </ul>
035     */
036    public record Activation(float[] inputs, float output, float[] parameterGradients_df_dp) {
037
038    }
039
040    /**
041     * The list of cached activations for this neuron.
042     */
043    private final List<Activation> cachedActivations = new LinkedList<>();
044
045    /**
046     * Constructs a new neuron with caching capabilities.
047     *
048     * @param name               the name of the neuron
049     * @param inputs             the list of input neurons
050     * @param activationFunction the activation function used by this neuron
051     */
052    public ActivationsCachedNeuron(String name, List<? extends Neuron> inputs, ActivationFunction activationFunction) {
053        super(name, inputs, activationFunction);
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Activates the neuron and caches the result.
058     *
059     * <p>If the neuron is already activated, this method does nothing.
060     * Otherwise, it performs the standard {@link Neuron#activate()} operation
061     * and stores an {@link Activation} record in the cache containing:
062     * inputs, logit, output, and gradient.
063     */
064    public synchronized void activate() {
065        if (isActivated()) {
066            return;
067        }
068        super.activate();
069        float[] inputValues = getInputValues();
070        float output = getOutput();
071        cachedActivations.add(new Activation(inputValues, output, calculateParameterGradients_df_dp(inputValues)));
072    }
073
074    /**
075     * Returns the cached activations.
076     *
077     * @return the list of {@link Activation} records representing past activations
078     */
079    public List<Activation> getCache() {
080        return cachedActivations;
081    }
082
083    /**
084     * Clears all cached activations.
085     *
086     * <p>This method is synchronized to ensure thread safety when modifying
087     * the cache.
088     */
089    public synchronized void clearCache() {
090        cachedActivations.clear();
091    }
092
093}
